intro: Dianthus queraltii, commonly known as the Sierra dianthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and produces clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or open habitats. Dianthus queraltii is a valuable addition to native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
